description: Thick leather body armor that has been hardened via chemical treatment.  Light and strong.
Leg and body armor made from the exoskeletons of insects.
Leg and body armor crafted from the carefully cleaned and pruned biosilicified exoskeletons of acidic ants.  Acid-resistant but brittle.
Thick body armor made from furs.
Thick body armor made from faux furs.
A full suit of thick leather body armor.  Light and comfortable.
A suit of Gothic plate armor.  The metal shows signs of rust and corrosion, and the leather straps are tattered.

A full set of armor hammered out from sheet metal and tied in place with leather straps and belts.  It's crude, heavy, and uncomfortable, but damn protective.  Now, you're a true Post-Apocalyptic Warrior.
A light suit of plate armor with a 2 mm thick chestpiece.
A suit of plate armor with a 4 mm thick chestpiece.
A heavy suit of plate armor with a 6 mm thick chestpiece.
Thick leather body armor that has been reinforced with strategically-placed metal plates.
An extremely heavy suit of ornamental armor.  The metal shows signs of rust and corrosion, and the leather straps are tattered.

A full suit of black plastic body armor plates used by riot police.  Cleverly placed velcro straps secure each piece, resulting in slightly less encumbrance then its constituent parts.  Molle webbing is attached to the torso and the word POLICE is emblazoned across the front.
An ornamental suit of Japanese samurai armor.
A suit of armor made from scraps of metal secured by simple strings to cloth wraps; the loose collection of plates provides decent but uncomfortable protection.
A suit of armor made from thick chunks of rubber tire secured by simple strings; the loose collection of rubber plates provides decent but not the most convenient protection.

A white suit commonly worn by professional beekeepers with straps on your ankles and wrists to prevent bees from flying in.  It's not a very tough fabric, but it's lightweight and has plenty of storage thanks to a chest pocket.
A knee-length long-sleeved tunic made of interlocking steel rings.  It can be adjusted to be worn as outerwear.

use_action.msg: You adjust your mail for a looser fit.

//: Suits have better coverage than separates because the parts are all attached to each other, leaving fewer gaps.

use_action.msg: You adjust your mail for a looser fit.
You adjust your mail for a looser fit.

description: A knee-length long-sleeved tunic made of interlocking steel rings.  It can be adjusted to fit closer to the body.

use_action.msg: You adjust your mail for a closer fit.
You adjust your mail for a closer fit.
You adjust your mail for a closer fit.

description: A knee-length long-sleeved tunic made of interlocking low-quality steel rings.  It can be adjusted to be worn as outerwear.

use_action.msg: You adjust your mail for a looser fit.

description: A knee-length long-sleeved tunic made of interlocking low-quality steel rings.  It can be adjusted to fit closer to the body.

use_action.msg: You adjust your mail for a closer fit.

description: A full-body suit of medieval chain armor, complete with a hood, gloves, and chausses.
//: Suits have better coverage than separates because the parts are all attached to each other, leaving fewer gaps.

description: Jury-rigged armor made by affixing a full-body suit of chainmail over a rubber cleansuit, with copper wire threaded through to create a low impedence route to the ground that doesn't travel through the wearer.  It is hot, heavy, and uncomfortable, and the plastic face shield doesn't help.
A simple hazardous materials handling suit.  Though not designed to stand up to combat, it should protect from chemicals, radiation, and other environmental hazards.
A flame-resistant whole-body garment worn by firefighters as protection against extreme heat.  It requires a separate gas mask for full protection against smoke.

Designed to stop the injuries of dog bites, this thick, one piece suit is often used in the rehabilitation of abused animals and in training dogs by the police and military.  A base layer of aramid fabric has had strips of soft body armor sewn into it to mimic quilting, and to soften the blunt of animals jumping, slashing, or pouncing on the wearer.
//: real bite suits are made with linen, but we don't have linen, so denim is the closest approx. (canvas is always waterproofed and these suits are not)

armor.//: skip second entry for arm encumbrance

//: Should be substantially more difficult to repair than ordinary plastic - ch_steel is difficulty 7
description: An impermeable whole-body garment worn as protection against hazardous materials.  Restrictive and fragile, wearing it will provide complete protection against ambient radiation.  It requires a separate gas mask for full protection.
A snug body suit made from thin and lightweight Nomex fire-resistant fabric.  Tough yet breathable, it is light and comfortable to wear under clothing.

A lightweight environmental suit incorporating Kevlar-lined boots and gloves, worn by Hub personnel in their rare forays aboveground.  Colored brown and blue, the white seal of Hub 01 is embroidered on both of its upper arms.  It requires a separate gas mask for full protection.
//: 2mm Nomex across the entire suit with a waterproof silicone outer to provide hazmat properties. Hands and feet reinforced/shaped with other materials to provide full-body hazmat protection with minimal encumbrance.

material.//: Back of hand from the wrist to the knuckles can be stiffer but still needs a little flexibility. This area can afford the most thickness on gloves.
Molded knuckle plates, spacious enough inside the gloves to flex your knuckles fine while providing extra knuckle protection because busting your knuckles sucks.
A bit of Kevlar between the third and second knuckles, the part of the fingers where flexibility is least important.
Fingers need to be the most flexible and tactile part of the hand. Lycra/nylon blend (as the lycra material is defined) will give both those qualities while sacrificing the least protection.
The boots are reinforced with plastic plates throughout to protect against penetration.
The Kevlar is 2mm thick over most of the boots, and 1mm thick for flexible joints.
Steel shank for excellent arch support and to maintain boot shape for longevity.

use_action.msg: You slip out of the top of the suit and tie the sleeves around your waist.

description: A lightweight environmental suit incorporating Kevlar-lined boots, worn by Hub personnel in their rare forays aboveground.  Colored brown and blue, the upper portion has been tied around the waist casually.

material.//: The boots are reinforced with plastic plates throughout to protect against penetration.
The Kevlar is 2mm thick over most of the boots, and 1mm thick for flexible joints.
Steel shank for excellent arch support and to maintain boot shape for longevity.

use_action.msg: You untie the sleeves and put back on the top of the suit.

description: A single-piece brown and orange environmental suit, tailored in a way that slightly recalls a military flight suit.  The letters "X.E.D.R.A" are inscribed on its back, and a white shoulder patch on the right arm shows an arrow reaching within rings of concentric circles.  It requires a separate gas mask for full protection.

use_action.msg: You slip out of the top of the suit and tie the sleeves around your waist.

description: A single-piece brown and orange environmental suit, tailored in a way that slightly recalls a military flight suit.  The upper portion has been tied around the waist casually.

use_action.msg: You untie the sleeves and put back on the top of the suit.

description: The WebbStar moisture retention suit utilizes advanced technology to prevent up to 30% of moisture loss through perspiration.  The suit is powered by the micro-motions of the body, especially breathing and walking motions.  Because of this, your walking speed is impaired while wearing it.
A full-body cotton suit.  Makes the apocalypse a truly gentlemanly experience.
A leather bodysuit with padding in high-impact areas, meant for motorcyclists out on the track.  The leather is stiff but makes the armor much sturdier and more protective than lighter counterparts.

A military officer's dress uniform from before the Cataclysm, complete with rank and ribbons.  Just looking at it gives you an air of authority.  Perhaps not the most practical military wear, but a very stylish option.
A sage-green US military flight suit.  It has various insignia embroidered onto it.

A full body multilayered suit of plate armor with a 4 mm thick chest piece.  The steel has been affixed over a full-body layered suit of weight-distributing straps.  The armor has an integrated breathable lycra jumpsuit and the torso has a spall liner of aramid panels.  Electronics run below the surface and circulate cool air to the skin, drawing power from your internal CBM reservoir.

use_action.msg: You turn the climate control on.
The %s pipes stop humming.

description: A full body multilayered light suit of plate armor with a 2 mm thick chest piece.  The steel has been affixed over a full-body layered suit of weight-distributing straps.  The armor has an integrated breathable lycra jumpsuit and the torso has a spall liner of aramid panels.  Electronics run below the surface and circulate cool air to the skin, drawing power from your internal CBM reservoir.

use_action.msg: You turn the climate control on.

The armor has an integrated breathable lycra jumpsuit and the torso has a spall liner of aramid panels.  Electronics run below the surface and circulate cool air to the skin, drawing power from your internal CBM reservoir.

description: A full body multilayered chainmail hauberk.  The steel has been affixed over a full-body layered suit of weight-distributing straps.  The armor has an integrated breathable lycra jumpsuit and the torso has a spall liner of aramid panels.  Electronics run below the surface and circulate cool air to the skin, drawing power from your internal CBM reservoir.

use_action.msg: You turn the climate control on.
